{"issues":[{"number":176,"title":"Converge skill should include /introspect 2","state":"OPEN","labels":["ai-authored","origin:agent","feature:enhancement","area:devtools:skills","area:devtools:self-improve"],"url":"https://github.com/e-vergo/Side-By-Side-Blueprint/issues/176","body":"The `/converge` skill should incorporate an `/introspect 2` cycle as part of its workflow — either at the end of the convergence loop (after report phase) or as a follow-up step.

🤖 Created with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)","created_at":"2026-02-04T12:40:38Z"},{"number":175,"title":"One-line gap between Lean proof declaration and proof body on toggle","state":"OPEN","labels":["ai-authored","origin:agent","bug:visual","area:sbs:theme","impact:visual"],"url":"https://github.com/e-vergo/Side-By-Side-Blueprint/issues/175","body":"## Description

When expanding a proof via the fold/unfold toggle, there is a visible blank line gap between the Lean signature (declaration) and the proof body in the right-side code column.

## Root Cause

Two factors combine:

1. jQuery's `slideDown()` (in `plastex.js:95` and `verso-code.js:204`) sets `display: block` on `<code class="lean-proof-body">`. The `<code>` element is normally inline.

2. The proof body HTML content starts with `\n  ` (newline + indentation). Inside a `<pre>` with `white-space: pre`, `display: block` forces a line break, plus the content `\n` adds another — producing a visible blank line gap.

## Affected Files

- `toolchain/dress-blueprint-action/assets/plastex.js:91-95` (slideUp/slideDown)
- `toolchain/dress-blueprint-action/assets/verso-code.js:203-205` (slideDown)
- `toolchain/Dress/Dress/Render/SideBySide.lean:142` (HTML generation)

## Fix Options

1. Strip leading `\n` from proof body content during HTML generation in `SideBySide.lean`
2. Use `display: inline` instead of `display: block` for the toggle (CSS override for slideDown behavior)
3. Both

## Testing Gap

No browser-driven test validates whitespace between signature and proof body elements. A `/qa` test checking for unexpected blank lines in expanded proofs would catch this.

---
🤖 Logged autonomously via sbs_issue_log","created_at":"2026-02-04T12:06:44Z"},{"number":174,"title":"Rainbow bracket regression in GCR: stale verso dependency","state":"OPEN","labels":["ai-authored","origin:agent","bug:visual","area:sbs:theme","impact:visual","project:gcr"],"url":"https://github.com/e-vergo/Side-By-Side-Blueprint/issues/174","body":"## Description

Rainbow bracket coloring is incorrect in GCR builds. Brackets at the same nesting level get different colors, and nested brackets get the same color as their parents.

**Example:** `(a [R] b)` renders all four brackets as `lean-bracket-1` instead of `( )` as `lean-bracket-1` and `[ ]` as `lean-bracket-2`.

## Root Cause

GCR's `lake-manifest.json` pins verso at `b17723e` (pre-fix), while SBS-Test correctly pins `61178cc` (the fix commit). The bracket fix (`61178cc "Fix rainbow bracket depth tracking"` and `d4d6cd8 "Rainbow brackets: Use global depth counter"`) exists in verso HEAD but was never propagated to GCR's manifest.

## Fix

Update GCR's lake-manifest to use current verso HEAD, rebuild.

## Testing Gap

No automated test validates that all projects (SBS-Test, GCR, PNT) share the same verso/Dress/SubVerso versions. Existing bracket tests only check CSS class existence, not coloring correctness. A cross-project manifest consistency test should be added.

---
